\text{If }A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2/3 & 1 & 5/3 \\ 1/3 & 2/3 & 4/3 \\ 7/3 & 2 & 2/3 \end{array} \right] \text{ and}\\ \quad B = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2/5 & 3/5 & 1 \\ 1/5 & 2/5 & 4/5 \\ 7/5 & 6/5 & 2/5 \end{array} \right]
\text{then,}\\ \text{are all the following statements true?}\\
step.tex: (i) \,\text{A and B have the same order.}\\ (ii) \,\text{A+B is defined and the resultant matrix }\\ \text{has order }3 \times 3.\\
(i) \,\text{A and B have the same order.}\\ (ii) \,\text{A+B is defined and the resultant matrix}\\ \text{is of order }1\times 1.
step.reason: \text{Only matrices having the {\bf same order} i.e.}\\ \text{equal no. of rows (m) and equal no. of}\\ \text{columns (n) can be added and the order}\\ \text{of the resultant matrix is also m \times n.}
